Dear Timothy Nelson:
Attached is the Special Investigation Report for the above referenced facility. Due to the
violations identified in the report, a written corrective action plan is required. The
corrective action plan is due 15 days from the date of this letter and must include the
following:
• How compliance with each rule will be achieved.
• Who is directly responsible for implementing the corrective action for each
violation.
• Specific time frames for each violation as to when the correction will be
completed or implemented.
• Indicate how continuing compliance will be maintained once compliance is
achieved.
• Be signed and dated.
If you desire technical assistance in addressing these issues, please feel free to contact
me. In any event, the corrective action plan is due within 15 days. Failure to submit an
acceptable corrective action plan will result in disciplinary action.
Please review the enclosed documentation for accuracy and contact me with any
questions. In the event that I am not available, and you need to speak to someone
immediately, please contact Jessica VandenHeuvel, the area manager at (616) 204-

Rule Code & COF Rule 400.10107 Employment policies and procedures
Section (1) A facility shall establish and follow written employment policies
Description and procedures that shall assure that staff are emotionally stable
and of suitable health, ability, experience, and education to
perform the duties assigned.
Violation Potential Rule or Statute Violation
Type
Allegation On 2/24/23, former youth, Youth B sexually assaulted Youth A in
the shower while at the facility. Youth B told Youth A to meet him
in the shower and not to tell anyone or else other youth would
jump him. Out of fear, Youth A met Youth B in the shower where
Youth B made Youth A get on his knees and perform oral sex.
Youth B then made Youth A stand, turned him around, and rubbed
his private parts. Youth B then shoved "it" inside of Youth A who
started crying. Youth B then allowed Youth A to leave out the
shower. Youth A then went back to his own shower, cleaned
himself off, went to his room, and cried himself to sleep.
On 3/4/23, Youth B did the same thing to Youth A in the shower
without force. A third similar incident occurred on an unknown
date at the facility, but at that time Youth B did not make Youth A
"suck it off." Staff 1 was on duty on 2/24/23 and 3/4/23 but was
not in proper position and did not properly supervise Youth A and
Youth B when the incident occurred.
Investigation Administrator 1/Complainant was interviewed via phone, on
4/26/2023. It was reported this sexual activity took place three
times and they were able to identify video recording of two of the
incidents. They are in the process of trying to locate the third
incident. Both Youth B and Youth C are no longer at the facility.
Administrator 1 reported finding out about the additional
allegations last Friday. He also reported Staff 1 did everything
2

correctly in supervising the youth until they began showers and
she positioned herself in an inappropriate location. Administrator
1/Complainant was interviewed face-to-face at the facility, on
4/26/2023 in collaboration with MDHHS worker. He provided even
further information about the allegations. He was told of the
incident from Supervisor 1 who informed him Staff 3 received the
information from Youth A. He reported sexual incidents took place
three times with Youth A, with two of them being forced and the
third voluntary. They have yet to identify the time of the third
incident. He also reported meeting with Youth A to gather more
information the day he was informed of the incidents (4/21/23) and
calling Law Enforcement after the meeting. Law Enforcement met
with Youth A and Staff 3 the same day. He reported having a
PREA investigation completed and will provide a copy. He also
provided the video recording of the incidents. He reported the
video recording on 3/4/23 shows Youth B going into the shower of
Youth A. Administrator 1/Complainant reported speaking to Youth
A’s father who informed him Youth A has a history of making
several accusations such as being raped in the past. During his
meeting with Youth A, Youth A reported telling Youth D about the
situation but in the PREA interview, Youth D denied this every
occurred. He reported Staff 1 informed him she had heard about
something happening “a while back” but had no specifics. He has
reviewed the video tape and Staff 1 was the staff supervising the
unit during both incidents reported by Youth A. When reviewing
the video recording, he reported observing Staff 1 out of position
and not watching the shower area. He reported she was walking
around and doing things on the unit. He stated, “she should have
positioned herself to watch the shower area per policy.”
Administrator 2 was interviewed face-to-face at the facility, on
4/26/2023 in collaboration with MDHHS worker. He reported
being informed of the allegations when he received a text
message from Supervisor 1 last Friday or Saturday. He reported
an incident in the past when Youth A said another youth tried to
kiss him but after it was investigated, the allegation was found to
be false. The facility did move the other youth to another unit to
protect Youth A. He watched the two video recordings and found
on the 2/24/23 video, Youth B was observed coming out of Youth
A’s shower and on the 3/4/23 video, Youth B is observed entering
and then leaving Youth A’s shower. He stated, “Staff 1 was
working the unit both times”. Administrator 2 suggested, the past
information Staff 1 was privileged to may have been when another
youth attempted to kiss Youth A, but he is not fully sure. He
reported being the supervisor who writes annual evaluations for
Staff 1 with feedback from shift supervisors. He reported Staff 1 is
3

a newer staff having worked at the facility between six and nine
months. Staff 1 just completed her six-month evaluation and he
stated, “she would not have passed her probation period if she
had issues”.
Staff 1 was interviewed face-to-face at the facility, on
4/26/2023 in collaboration with MDHHS worker. She reported
being told by Administrator 1 that “something” happened. She
reported being told of Youth A being assaulted in the shower while
she was supervising the unit and she was “shocked” because she
does not remember anything from those days. She was not aware
of the incident and surprised because she has a “very good”
relationship with Youth A. She described her actions when
supervising the unit during shower time. Youth begin showers
between 8:00 and 8:30 and she will let two of the youth out of their
rooms at a time. All the other youth are locked in their rooms. Staff
1 reported Supervisor 4 told her; she can let two youth at a time
out while male staff are allowed to let three youth at a time take
showers. She reported since being told about the incident she
now only allows one youth to shower at a time. She understands
she is to sit and monitor the youth during shower time, but female
staff cannot sit directly in front of the shower, and she reported
fearing someone would accuse her of looking at the youth when
showering. She learned the need to sit during her training. Staff 1
reported the youth are given seven minutes to shower and during
this time she needs to complete notes, complete room checks
(every 15-minutes), clean up the unit (spray off tables and chairs),
spray off shower shoes, pass out medication if the nurse shows
up, and sign off on and pass out snacks when the floating staff
shows up with snacks. She reported learning to keep line of sight
but felt uncomfortable keeping line of sight when youth are in the
shower. She also reported having someone speak to her over the
intercom, telling her she cannot sit away from the shower. She
stated, “I want a supervisor to tell me where to sit” but she has not
had a conversation with a supervisor until today. She also
reported after being told by another youth that Youth C was
touching or asking Youth A for a kiss, she spoke to Supervisor 2
about this information and Youth C was moved to another unit.
Youth A was interviewed via phone, on 5/1/2023 in
collaboration with MDHHS worker and Law Enforcement.
Youth A reported he does not want to talk about the incidents that
took place with Youth B. He then reported it occurred three
separate times when Youth B was in the shower next to him.
Youth B told Youth A to come into the shower with him and “other
stuff happened.” Youth A denied sexual actions took place with
4

any other youth at the facility. The incidents were reported to have
occurred three times in the middle of February. Youth A at first
reported the first time was forced and the next two were not, later
Youth A changed this statement to report never having a choice.
Youth A reported Staff 1 was the staff supervising the unit during
the first and third incidents and was unable to recall the staff
present during the second incident. Youth A reported youth are
picked at random for showers and given seven minutes to shower.
Youth A reported knowing where staff stand during shower time
and somehow knew Staff 1 was walking around completing room
checks. Youth A reported other staff “do not do other things, they
just watch us during showers.” Youth A reported he showers alone
since being placed in a new unit at the facility. Youth A reported
being threatened by Youth B if he said anything and Youth B said,
Youth C, Youth F, and Youth G would beat him up. Youth A
reported the threats as “blackmailing me and threatening to stomp
the shit out of me and break my jaw.” These were the reasons he
did not report the incident. Youth A also reported everything
written in the grievance form was true and accurate. Everything
came out when Youth A was talking to Youth D and Staff 3
overheard their conversation. Youth A reported feeling safe at the
facility since moving to the new unit. He reported all staff are like
Staff 1, “they do their job the right way”.
Supervisor 1 was interviewed face-to-face at the facility, on
5/9/2023 in collaboration with MDHHS worker. She reported
being informed of the sexual assaults by Staff 3 after Staff 3 was
informed from Youth A and reported this information to
administration. Supervisor 1 spoke with Youth A after obtaining
this information and asked him to author a report of the incidents.
She found no differences between Youth A’s statement to her and
what he wrote in his report. She reported Youth A stated needing
someone to tell because the situation hit Youth A hard. Supervisor
1 gave an account of staff’s process during shower time on the
unit. Staff will choose the youth who are going to take a shower
and should only chose one youth at a time if feeling
uncomfortable. Staff should not be walking around. They should
sit in a location so they can observe if youth are trying to cross the
room to the other shower. Staff should not be doing anything else
while youth are in the shower but observe the shower area. Room
checks are to take place between youth showering and snacks
can wait until shower time is over. Supervisor 1 reported a youth
specialist is not allowed to pass medication and the nurse enters
the unit and passes medication. She also reported “Central
Control” who monitors units should have spoken to a Shift
5

Supervisor if Staff 1 was sitting in the wrong position to monitor
the showers rather than saying something directly to Staff 1.
Staff 2 was interviewed face-to-face at the facility, on 5/9/2023
in collaboration with MDHHS worker. She reported working as
a Youth Specialist at the facility for the past four years. She also
reported staff have the option to have one youth at a time go into
the showers but if they chose to have two youth in the shower,
they must sit in a position so they can ensure the youth stay
separated. Staff are not to walk around during showers and must
sit and monitor, “it’s just common sense.” Staff 2 reported telling
the nurse to wait if she has two youth in the shower and she will
leave the snacks until she has time to pass them out. Room
checks are done between showers and especially not done when
there are two youth in the shower area. She also reported never
working with Staff 1 but did believe Staff 1 may have some
boundary issues with youth since she has overheard youth call
her “mom”. Staff 2 does not allow this and after being redirected, if
the youth calls her mom again, she will issue a time-out.
Staff 3 was interviewed face-to-face at the facility, on 5/9/2023
in collaboration with MDHHS worker. She reported overhearing
Youth D say to Youth A “you need to report that” twice so she
approached them and asked what “needs to be reported.” She
asked Youth A for details and Youth A reported being raped in the
shower by Youth B. Staff 3 at first though it was a prior incident in
which Youth C asked Youth A for a kiss, however, Youth A stated
Youth C knew about the rape. Youth A reported to Staff 3 the
sexual rape occurred three times but was unclear of a time for the
incidents. Staff 3 informed Supervisor 1 who requested more
information. Staff 3 gathered more information and authored a
report about the information provided by Youth A. Staff 3 also
informed Supervisor 3 about the information because Supervisor 3
completes PREA reports. Staff 3 described the shower process. If
youth get along, Staff 3 will pick them to both shower at the same
time and if staff pick two youth to shower at the same time, they
need to sit close enough to observe if one tried to go across to the
other shower. Staff also need to listen to the youth while in the
shower and pay close attention because, they are not supposed to
talk in the showers. Staff 3 reported they try to have only one
youth in the shower at a time. Regarding other activities by staff
while youth are in the shower, she stated, “room checks before
and after showers, snacks before or after, and all medication is
passed by the nurse not staff.” Staff 3 also reported it is
inappropriate for youth to call a female staff “mom” because it
6

crosses boundaries. She did not report being aware of any
concerns about Staff 1.
Staff 4 was interviewed face-to-face at the facility, on 5/9/2023
in collaboration with MDHHS worker. Staff 4 reported being a
liaison worker from the 180 program and working with Youth A.
She reported Youth A informed her of sexual harassment on the
Echo unit and she informed Administrator 1. She informed
Administrator 1 about Youth C asking Youth A for a kiss but was
unclear when this conversation occurred. She reported not
knowing if youth showered alone after the documentation
indicated this was recommended.
Supervisor 2 was interviewed via the phone, on 5/12/2023 in
collaboration with MDHHS worker. She reported having no
firsthand knowledge of the incidents of rape with Youth A in the
shower of Echo Unit. She also reported hearing about Youth C
asking Youth A for a kiss and to “suck his D” in a staff team
meeting. Youth C was moved to another unit following this
information. She did not know if this information was passed to
administration so Youth C would be placed on “three star” statues.
She reported three-star status is when a youth is identified having
sexual issues and needs to shower alone and be watched more
diligently.
Supervisor 3 was interviewed via the phone, on 5/12/2023 in
collaboration with MDHHS worker. She reported conducting the
PREA investigation after receiving information on the allegations.
She also reported Youth A was defensive and when asked the
same question in a different form, gave different answers. She
had no prior or further interactions with Youth A. Youth A was
moved to a different unit after reports of being bullied. She
provided the following information about the youth specialist’s role
during shower time on the units. The youth specialist is to only
observe the showers when a youth is in the shower. They are
required to sit and observe/monitor the showers to ensure the
youth are safe. When she has observed/monitored showers,
Supervisor 3 will stand in the doorway without looking in and have
each youth raise their hand to identify where they are in the
shower. She will then sit so she can see their feet under the
shower curtain and then have them come out of the shower one at
a time. She reported the youth can ask to take a shower alone
and if they are on “three star” statues, they must take a shower
alone. Supervisor 3 also reported Staff 1 has boundary issues with
the youth and Staff 1 was being groomed by an older youth at one
time. She was unable to provide any details other than to suggest,
7

Staff 1 likes to work with the older youth in the facility. Because
Supervisor 3 manages the youth grievances she reported
receiving grievances about Staff 1 treating some youth with more
favor than others.
Supervisor 4 was interviewed via the phone, on 5/12/2023 in
collaboration with MDHHS worker. He reported working mostly
third shift and had almost no contact with Youth A or other youth.
He was informed of the allegations by Administrator 2 during a
supervisor meeting. He also reported being told about Youth C
asking Youth A to kiss him and “suck his dick” in a meeting. He
denied speaking to Staff 1 about the number of youth she can
have in the shower at a time and reported she would have learned
this information in her training.
Documents Reviewed:
Juvenile Detention Center Status Report Youth A. This report
covers Youth A up to 4/14/23. It is documented, Youth A has had
several extended consequences recently and will continue in
detention until placement is found.
Kent County Juvenile Detention Center Grievance Form dated
4/21/2023 signed by Youth A. This document begins with Youth
A recording being raped three separate times by Youth B during
the month of February. It is documented Youth B approached
Youth A at a table in the shared area when the unit was on half-up
and half-down status. Youth B is reported to have asked Youth A
to meet him in the shower later that day because he had a
surprise he wanted to share. Youth B informed Youth A if he told
anyone Youth B would have Youth C, Youth F, and Youth G beat
Youth A. Staff were allowing only two youth in the shower area at
a time and when Youth A came to the showers, Youth B told him
to come into his shower with him. Youth B forced Youth A to
provide oral sex before engaging in sodomizing Youth A. Youth A
documented he went to bed crying. Youth A documented the
second time being raped happened on another day (no date is
identified) when the unit was on half-up and half-down. Youth A
recorded it was like the first time with Youth B and Youth A just
went along with it. The third rape is documented without a date
and the only difference is Youth A did not engage in oral sex. The
letter ends with the statement “he just had his fun with me.”
Allegation/Summary PREA investigation. This document
contains numerous documents, and each will be reviewed.
8

• Summary of interview (Youth A) dated 4/22/2023. Youth
A is documented as giving similar information that he
presented on his grievance form except for Staff 1 being
identified. Youth A reported the incident took place in the
“middle of February” and he did not report it to anyone. It is
documented Youth A stated the second incident occurred
one week later and the same actions as described in his
grievance form occurred. Youth A reported Youth C was
“sexually harassing” Youth A and was moved to another
unit. Youth A is documented as talking with Youth D and
Youth E on Thursday 4/20/2023 about being raped and
Staff 3 overheard Youth D say “you need to report that, and
Staff 3 asked about it.
• Summary of interview (Youth D) dated 4/22/2023. Youth
D denied ever saying “you need to report that to Youth A
and denied he was sitting at the table because he never
sits there.
• Interview with Youth A by Administrator 2 with no date.
Youth A reported a belief the incidents occurred around
February 9, February 16, February 21. Youth A was unsure
why he did not resist Youth B. Youth A also reported staff
do not usually tell youth which shower to use so Youth B
would use the shower next to Youth A.
• Video Observations 4/24/23 thru 4/26/23 conducted by
the facility. This report documents Youth A and Youth B
showered at the same time on the following dates. 2/19/23,
2/24/23, 3/3/23, and 3/4/23. There is nothing significant
documented on 2/19/23 and 3/3/23. However, on 2/24/23 it
is documented Youth A is observed exiting Youth B’s
shower stall and entering Youth A’s shower stall. On
3/4/23, Youth A is observed entering Youth B’s shower
stall. Youth B is observed motioning Youth A back to the
other stall and then closing the curtain on his stall.
Approximately 6 minutes later, Youth A is observed leaving
Youth B’s shower stall and going to the next stall. In
summary it is documented Staff 1 was working both on
2/24/23 and 3/4/23 and “doing everything right except being
stationary near the shower area”. Staff 1 being out of
position “contributed to the youth being able to participate
in the alleged sexual abuse”. This document ends with
Administrator 2 documenting Staff 1 “will receive a yet to be
determined level of discipline”.
9

• Narrative dated 4/20/23 from Staff 3. In this document,
Staff 3 reported the events that took place on 4/20/2023
involving Youth A. She documented hearing Youth D tell
Youth A “you need to report that.” She asked Youth D what
he said, and he repeated the statement. Youth A told her
about being raped three times in the shower on different
days. Youth A informed her Youth B was the individual who
did the rape and Youth C knew about the incidents. Youth
A reported these incidents occurred on days there was only
one staff present on the unit.
• Supplemental dated 4/20/23 from Supervisor 1. It is
documented Supervisor 1 spoke with Youth A and Youth A
informed him of wanting to make a report because Youth A
kept thinking about it. Supervisor 1 documented telling
Youth A to write everything down so a statement could be
given to the PREA representative.
• Detention Notes dated 3/16/23 from Supervisor 4. It is
documented Youth A reported being harassed and
threatened by unit peers and “they say they will get him in
the shower.” Supervisor 3 directed staff to shower Youth A
alone and recommended that practice continue going
forward.
Human Resources file for Staff 1 was reviewed. There was no
documentation of any disciplinary action against Staff 1 in the file.
Training records document Staff 1 completing new hire orientation
on 10/10/2022 and completing her policy reviews on 11/20/22 and
12/30/22. Her orientation training included but not limited to, job
duties/role/responsibilities, child management techniques,
discipline/de-escalation, and developmental needs of children.
Detention Procedures Manual Unit and Building Security
300.8 2/25/19. This outlines the staff’s responsibility during
showers. The document states there are to be no more than three
youth in the shower area at a time and when only one staff is
present, room checks are to be done between youth’s shower
time. The process outlines, the room check is to occur following
the youth’s return to their room and before the next youth is
allowed out for a shower. The staff supervising the youth
showering are to be “near the shower room entrance.”
Detention Procedures Manual Unit and Building Security
100.1. Administrative 2/25/19. IX Reporting Suspected Child
Abuse or Neglect of a New Admission. This document outlines
the following, “childcare personnel who have reasonable cause to
10

suspect child abuse or neglect immediately make an oral report of
the suspected abuse or neglect to DHHS. The staff person
working within the Kent County Juvenile Detention Center who is
first aware of suspected abuse will refer the matter to the Youth
Specialist Shift Supervisor. The Youth Specialist Shift Supervisor
will ensure that a 3200 form is completed and reported to DHHS.
Incident and supplemental reports are required for all abuse
reporting staff.”
Detention Procedures Manual – Medical Procedures 700.1
8/21/12. This document outlines the process of providing medical
care and dispensing medication to the youth in care. It is stated in
this document, “Health Care Authority will dispense medications
when they are on duty.’ It is also stated, “In cases of extreme
emergency, when the nurse is not on duty, or in other special
circumstances, the Shift Supervisor will dispense medications.
The dispensing of medications is never to be assigned to a Youth
Specialist.”
Detention Procedures Manual –Schedule of Daily routine
200.1 8/21/12. This document outlines the cleaning process of
both shared areas, bedrooms, toilet area, showers, and the staff
office. Youth are to be involved in the cleaning except for the staff
office. Staff are also to provide close supervision of youth when
engaged in the cleaning process.
Echo Unit Log dated 2/24/23 2nd shift. This document outlines
showers and “clean up” were completed from 9:00 to 10:30 pm.
Room checks were documented as being completed every 15-
minutes during the shower/clean up time.
Echo Unit Log dated 3/4/23 2nd shift. This document outlines
showers/clean up as occurring from 9:00 to 10:30 pm. Room
checks were documented as being completed every 15-minutes
during the shower/clean up time.
Review of video recording. A review of the video recording
dated 3/4/2023 was completed. There are two camera views of
the unit shared area of the incident outlined by Youth A. The video
begins with Staff 1 giving something to Youth B as both are
standing near a table near the staff office. Youth B returns to his
room and a few seconds later comes out of the room and heads
towards the shower area. Youth A then enters the shared area
and heads straight to the shower area following Youth B. Staff 1
never leaves from standing in front of the table in front of the staff
office. Both youth are observed entering the showers and appear
11

to follow one another into the far shower on the right side of the
room. Staff 1 throughout the time of the video is taking an item or
items from either the table or a stack of portable drawers near the
table and presenting them to different rooms. Some of the rooms,
she unlocks and others she just opens the door. Both youth are
not visible from either camera view and Staff 1 only twice looks in
the direction of the shower room door. At one point she goes
through another door on the far side of the staff office but returns
to the shared area in a few seconds. The two times she is close to
the shower area is to take things to the youth’s rooms who are in
the shower. Staff 1 can be heard yelling for both youth to end their
showers and when they do exit, she is sitting at the table in front
of the staff office doing paperwork. She does not appear to look
up as they head to their rooms. Both cameras provide the same
information.
Analysis Based upon interviews, written documentation, and video
recording, evidence supports Staff 1 did not follow the facilities
procedures in providing protection and supervision of Youth A and
Youth B when they were in the showers. DHHS reported Staff 1
will have a confirmed case.
CONSULTATION:
It was recommended the facility develop a system to ensure
information documented in the shift logs on an individual youth is
passed along to all staff involved in the supervision of the youth.
This was also recommended to be developed in a
policy/procedure.
It was recommended when an evaluation is completed on a staff,
all the information gathered from different supervisors be
incorporated into the evaluation.
Conclusion Repeat Violation Established
SIR 2021C0112030 dated 8/3/21; CAP Approved 8/27/21.
Rule Code & COF Rule 400.10127 Compliance with child protection law;
Section development of plan required.
Description (1) A facility shall develop and implement a written plan to assure
compliance with the provisions of Act No. 238 of the Public Acts of
1975, as amended, being S722.621 et seq. of the Michigan
Compiled Laws and known as the child protection law.
Violation Additional Findings of Non-Compliance
Type
Allegation Staff 1 reported being informed of Youth A being raped 15 times
but only informed Supervisor 4.
12

Investigation Staff 1 was interviewed face-to-face at the facility, on
4/26/2023 in collaboration with MDHHS worker. Staff 1 reported
she was surprised of not knowing the allegations because Youth A
has shared issues with her since first entering the program. She
stated, “the day Youth A entered the program and first met me
Youth A shared his father raped him.” She reported not doing
anything with this information other than telling Supervisor 4. She
believed she did not have to take any other action with this
information or the information about Youth A’s report of being
raped fifteen times by his father.
Supervisor 4 was interviewed via the phone, on 5/12/2023 in
collaboration with MDHHS worker. He denied Staff 1 ever told
him about Youth A’s report of being raped fifteen times by his
father. Supervisor 4 reported if staff are informed of information of
child abuse or neglect, they are to report the incident to
authorities.
Youth A was interviewed face-to-face at the facility, on
5/18/2023. Youth A reported never informing any staff (Staff 1 nor
Staff 3) about being “raped fifteen times” and stated that never
happened.
Documents Reviewed:
Mental Health History (Network 180) for Youth A dated
1/27/2023. On this document Youth A responded to several
mental health questions with a yes or no. He reported a yes to the
question of him being abused in the past and reported the abuse
was not sexual in nature.
Detention Procedures Manual – Admission/Release 100.1
dated 8/21/12. This document states, a staff person aware of
suspected abuse will refer the matter to the Youth Specialist Shift
Supervisor and the Supervisor will ensure the correct reporting
form is completed and sent to DHHS. The document also states
observations by Youth Specialists will be recorded in the youth’s
classification record.
Allegation/Summary PREA investigation. Narrative dated
4/20/23 from Staff 3. In this document, Staff 3 reported the events
